content:
Diagnosis:	Pineal region papillary tumor, WHO grade II

Management:	12 March 2024 - Endoscopic third ventriculostomy and tumor biopsy

Histology:	Papillary tumor of the pineal region, WHO grade II. GFAP and cytokeratin positive. Ki-67 10%.

Current Situation:	Post-operative review

I reviewed [redacted name] following his recent neurosurgical intervention for a newly diagnosed pineal region tumor. He initially presented with a 3-month history of progressive headaches and intermittent diplopia. MRI brain demonstrated a well-circumscribed enhancing mass in the pineal region measuring 2.8 x 2.4 cm with associated obstructive hydrocephalus.

He underwent endoscopic third ventriculostomy and tumor biopsy on 12/03/24, which confirmed a WHO grade II papillary tumor of the pineal region. The procedure was uncomplicated, and post-operative imaging shows good resolution of the hydrocephalus. His symptoms have significantly improved, with complete resolution of the diplopia and marked improvement in headaches.

On examination today, he is alert and oriented with no focal neurological deficits. His visual fields are full to confrontation, and extraocular movements are intact. His gait is steady and Romberg's test is negative.

I have discussed the case with our neuro-oncology MDT. Given the WHO grade II histology and the significant symptomatic improvement following CSF diversion, we recommend close surveillance rather than immediate further intervention. We have arranged an MRI brain in 8 weeks' time, following which we will review him in clinic with the results. I have provided him with written information about papillary tumors of the pineal region and our contact details should he develop any new symptoms.

He understands the surveillance plan and the importance of reporting any new neurological symptoms promptly. We will see him again following his next MRI scan.
